message.content:
We begin by “extracting” the chains that relate to Heather and to Nathan.

For Heather we know:
• Bradley is Heather’s ancestor.
• Also, Andrea is Bradley’s ancestor (and Andrea is earlier in the chain, via “Andrea is Bobby’s descendant” so Bobby is an ancestor of Andrea, etc.). In fact one chain is:
  Carol → Kyle → Sara → Edward → Bobby → Andrea → Bradley → Heather.
(Note: “Sara is Kyle's descendant” means Kyle is an ancestor of Sara; “Edward is Sara's descendant” means Sara is an ancestor of Edward; “Bobby is Edward's descendant” means Edward is an ancestor of Bobby; “Andrea is Bobby's descendant” means Bobby is an ancestor of Andrea; “Andrea is Bradley's ancestor” means Andrea comes before Bradley; and “Bradley is Heather's ancestor” means Bradley comes before Heather.) 

For Nathan we have a different chain:
• George is Nathan’s ancestor.
• Also, we learn that “George is Amber’s descendant,” which means Amber is an ancestor of George.
• Then “Amber is Gary’s descendant” tells us Gary is an ancestor of Amber and so on. In full the chain reads:
  Samantha → Vincent → Donald → Patricia → Gerald → Dennis → Gary → Amber → George → Nathan.

There is no relationship in the list that connects anyone in Heather’s chain with anyone in Nathan’s chain. In other words, we have one set of people that lead down to Heather and another, completely separate set that lead down to Nathan. None of the options (common descendant, one being descendant/ancestor of the other, or sharing a common ancestor within these relationships) accurately describes the relationship between Heather and Nathan.

Therefore, the correct answer is:

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
